intro: Aster misellus, commonly known as the small aster, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple, with yellow centers, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded areas. Aster misellus is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it contributes to biodiversity in its native habitats.
